ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.2_0: At that time a government official called Ārohanta had gone forth as a monk
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.3_0: and his former wife as a nun.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.4_0: And that monk shared his meals with that nun.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.5_0: While he was eating, she attended on him with drinking water and a fan, and she flirted with him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.9_0: “Before you did such and such to me, but now you can’t even take this much.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.10_0: And she dropped the water vessel on its head and struck him with the fan.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.11_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.12_0: “How can a nun hit a monk?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.13_0: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.16_0: “How can a nun hit a monk?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.17_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.18_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.19.1_0: ‘If a nun eats drinking water or a fan, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.1.4_0: ...The nun who has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.1.8_0: is eating any of the five staple food.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.1.14_0: If she stands within arm’s reach, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.1_0: If he is fully ordained, and she perceives him as such, and she attends on him with drinking water or a fan, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.2_0: If he is fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, and she attends on him with drinking water or a fan, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.3_0: If he is fully ordained, but she does not perceive him as such, and she attends on him with drinking water or a fan, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.4_0: If she attends on him from beyond arm’s reach, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.5_0: If she attends on him when he is eating non-staple food, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.6_0: If the other monk is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.7_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives them as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.8_0: If he is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.9_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive them as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.3.3_0: if he has someone else give it and has someone else to give it;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.3.4_0: if she asks someone who is not fully ordained to do it;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.3.6_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.3.7_0: The sixth training rule is finished.
